New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit his National League-leading 44th homer
Key Match Events: Tommy Edman broke a 6-6 tie with a two-run single in the top of the ninth inning
Ohtani, Mookie Betts and Freddie Freeman hit consecutive homers for the Dodgers to lead off the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the first two of a four-game set against the second-place D-backs at Chase Field
Ohtani finished the night 1-for-5 while his 98 RBIs tied him with Marcell Ozuna of the Atlanta Braves for the NL lead

Among other Japanese players in the majors, Houston Astros left-hander Yusei Kikuchi (7-9) picked up the win after striking out 12 in seven innings of one-run ball in a 5-2 victory over the Kansas City Royals
